nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: SQL ( ESS-kew-EL or SEE-kwl, Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system (RDBMS), or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system (RDSMS).

nodes.name: Software Development
nodes.description: Software development is the process of computer programming, documenting, testing, and bug fixing involved in creating and maintaining applications and frameworks resulting in a software product.

nodes.name: Java
nodes.description: Java is a set of computer software and specifications developed by Sun Microsystems, which was later acquired by the Oracle Corporation, that provides a system for developing application software and deploying it in a cross-platform computing environment.

nodes.name: Python
nodes.description: Python is a widely used high-level programming language for general-purpose programming, created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.

nodes.name: Software Engineering
nodes.description: Software engineering (SE) is the application of engineering to the development of software in a systematic method.

nodes.name: Project Management
nodes.description: Project management is the discipline of initiating, planning, executing, controlling, and closing the work of a team to achieve specific goals and meet specific success criteria.

nodes.name: JavaScript
nodes.description: JavaScript (), often abbreviated as JS, is a high-level, dynamic, weakly typed, object-based, multi-paradigm, and interpreted client-side programming language.

nodes.name: Customer Service
nodes.description: Customer service is the provision of service to customers before, during and after a purchase.

nodes.name: Linux
nodes.description: Linux (pronounced LIN-ks or, less frequently, LYN-ks) is a Unix-like computer operating system assembled under the model of free and open-source software development and distribution.

nodes.name: DevOps
nodes.description: Working experience of DevOps. DevOps is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that increases an organization's ability to deliver applications and services at high velocity: evolving and improving products at a faster pace than organizations using traditional software development and infrastructure management processes.

nodes.name: Cooking
nodes.description: Cooking or cookery is the art, technology and craft of preparing food for consumption with or without the use of heat.

nodes.name: Food Prep
nodes.description: Food preparation  preparing food for eating, generally requires selection, measurement and combination of ingredients in an ordered procedure so as to achieve desired results.

nodes.name: Restaurant Experience
nodes.description: Requires Restaurant Experience, which is experience working at an establishment where meals are served to customers.

nodes.name: Food Safety
nodes.description: Food safety is a scientific discipline describing handling, preparation, and storage of food in ways that prevent foodborne illness.

nodes.name: Scheduling
nodes.description: A schedule or a timetable, as a basic time-management tool, consists of a list of times at which possible tasks, events, or actions are intended to take place, or of a sequence of events in the chronological order in which such things are intended to take place.

nodes.name: Bartending
nodes.description: Bartending is the act of formulating and serving alcoholic or soft drink beverages behind the bar, usually in a licensed establishment.

nodes.name: Food Service Experience
nodes.description: Foodservice(US English) or catering industry (British English)definesthose businesses, institutions, and companies responsible for any meal prepared outside the home. This industry includes restaurants, school and hospital cafeterias, catering operations, and many other formats

nodes.name: Guest Services
nodes.description: Working experience of Guest Services, which at a hotel are the services, amenities and help that the hotel provides for its guests.

nodes.name: Housekeeping
nodes.description: Housekeeping refers to the management of duties and chores involved in the running of a household, such as cleaning, cooking, home maintenance, shopping, laundry and bill pay.

nodes.name: Repair
nodes.description: Restoration of a broken, damaged, or failed device, equipment, part, or property to an acceptable operating or usable condition or state.

nodes.name: Laundry
nodes.description: Laundry is the washing of clothing and linens.

nodes.name: Equipment Cleaning
nodes.description: Experience working with methods, and chemicals to facilitate and expedite the process of cleaning equipment.

nodes.name: Lifting Ability
nodes.description: Requires Lifting Ability, which is the ability to raise and object to a higher position or level, or pick up and move an object to a different position.

nodes.name: Furniture Moving
nodes.description: Working experience of Furniture Moving, which is services for relocations like packing, loading, moving, unloading, unpacking, arranging of items to be shifted. Additional services may include cleaning services for houses, offices or warehousing facilities.

nodes.name: Occupational Health and Safety
nodes.description: Occupational safety and health (OSH), also commonly referred to as occupational health and safety (OHS), occupational health, or workplace health and safety (WHS), is a multidisciplinary field concerned with the safety, health, and welfare of people at work.

nodes.name: Patient Care
nodes.description: The services rendered by members of the health profession and non-professionals under their supervision for the benefit of the patient.

nodes.name: Vital Signs Measurement
nodes.description: Vital signs (often shortened to just vitals) are a group of the 4 to 6 most important signs that indicate the status of the bodys vital (life-sustaining) functions.

nodes.name: Bathing
nodes.description: Bathing is the washing of the body with a fluid, usually water or an aqueous solution, or the immersion of the body in water.

nodes.name: Phlebotomy
nodes.description: Phlebotomy is the process of making an incision in a vein with a needle.

nodes.name: Activities of Daily Living (ADLS)
nodes.description: Activities of daily living (ADLs or ADL) is a term used in healthcare to refer to people's daily self care activities.

nodes.name: ADLs Assistance
nodes.description: Activities of daily living (ADLs or ADL) is a term used in healthcare to refer to people's daily self care activities.

nodes.name: Home Health
nodes.description: Home care (also referred to as domiciliary care, social care, or in-home care) is supportive care provided in the home.

nodes.name: Caregiving
nodes.description: A caregiver or carer is an unpaid or paid member of a person's social network who helps them with activities of daily living.

nodes.name: Meal Preparation
nodes.description: Meal preparation, sometimes called meal prep, is the process of planning and preparing meals.

nodes.name: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)
nodes.description: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) is an emergency procedure that combines chest compressions often with artificial ventilation in an effort to manually preserve intact brain function until further measures are taken to restore spontaneous blood circulation and breathing in a person who is in cardiac arrest.

nodes.name: Child Care
nodes.description: Child care or childcare, child minding, daycare, or preschool is the caring for and supervision of a child or children, usually from age six weeks to age thirteen.

nodes.name: Home Care
nodes.description: Home care (also referred to as domiciliary care, social care, or in-home care) is supportive care provided in the home.

nodes.name: Carpentry
nodes.description: Carpentry is a skilled trade in which the primary work performed is the cutting, shaping and installation of building materials during the construction of buildings, ships, timber bridges, concrete formwork, etc.

nodes.name: Painting
nodes.description: Painting is the practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium to a solid surface (support base).

nodes.name: Plumbing
nodes.description: Plumbing is any system that conveys fluids for a wide range of applications.

nodes.name: Hand Tools
nodes.description: A hand tool is any tool that is powered by hand rather than a motor.

nodes.name: Power Tools
nodes.description: A power tool is a tool that is actuated by an additional power source and mechanism other than the solely manual labour used with hand tools.

nodes.name: Electrical Work
nodes.description: Electrical work is the craft of an electrician

nodes.name: Cleaning
nodes.description: Cleaning is the process of removing unwanted substances, such as dirt, infectious agents, and other impurities, from an object or environment.

nodes.name: Forklift Operation
nodes.description: A forklift (also called lift truck, fork truck, fork hoist, and forklift truck) is a powered industrial truck used to lift and move materials over short distances.

nodes.name: Commercial Driving
nodes.description: No Definition.

nodes.name: HAZMAT
nodes.description: Working with hazardous materials (HAZMAT)  — substances in quantities or forms that may pose a reasonable risk to health, property, or the environment. .

nodes.name: Sorting
nodes.description: Sorting is any process of arranging items systematically, and has two common, yet distinct meanings:ordering: arranging items in a sequence ordered by some criterion;categorizing: grouping items with similar properties.

nodes.name: Basic Mathematics
nodes.description: Mathematics is the study of topics such as quantity (numbers), structure, space, and change.
